comment: An opening that often leads to attacking rather than postional games.
The Caro-Kann defense. It is somewhat passive but difficult to break through.
Controlling the center with pawns.
Contesting the center.
Developing a piece and protecting the pawn on e4.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4
comment: Eliminating part of White's pawn center.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4
comment: Recapturing.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6
comment: Developing and attacking the knight on e4.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3
comment: More usual is Nxf6.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6
comment: Opening lines for the bishop on f8. 5... h5 may have been better.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3
comment: A natural developing move.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5
comment: Planning to exchange White's remainnig center pawn. Perhaps it would have been more prudent to make a developing move.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3
comment: The best place for the bishop. 7. Be2 would be passive and 7. Bb5+ 7... Bd7 would lead to nothing. If Black tries 7... cxd4 8. Nxd4 Qxd4 then 9. Bb5+ wins the queen.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6
comment: Developing the knight and attacking the pawn on d4.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5
comment: Notice that the placement of White's bishop prevents a queen exchange.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5
comment: Recapturing and developing the bishop at the same time.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3
comment: Preparing for an eventual b4 followd by Bb2 while preventing Nb4.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O
comment: Getting the king out of the center and bringing the rook into play.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O
comment: Following suit.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6
comment: To develop the bishop on b7.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4
comment: Attacking the bishop and preparing Bb2 where the bishop will exert strong pressure on the Black kingside.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2
comment: As planned.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5
comment: Chasing away the knight so that White can play Ne5.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5
comment: There is an old saying that a knight on the rim is dim. But where else can the knight go?

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5
comment: A knight posted in the center is a very powerful piece. Bishops work best at a distance.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4
comment: Threatening 16. Nxf6 Bxf6 17. Bxf6 gxf6 weakening Black's king position. If 15... Nxg4 then after 16. Qxg4 Black must weaken the king position with 16... g6.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8
comment: Protecting the knight to avoid doubled pawns.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3
comment: If now 16... Qc7 then 17. Nh5 Qd8 18. Nxg7 Kxg7 19. Qg4+ Kh8 20. Qh4 Kg8 21. Bxf6 Bxf6 22. Qxh7#.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5
comment: A mistake. The knight is needed on the kingside to defend the king.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5
comment: Threatening Qxh7#. If 17... h6 then 18. Bxg7 Kxg7 19. Ngf5+ exf5 20. Nxf5+ Kg8 21. Qxh6 Bf6 22. Ne7+ Qxe7 23. Qh7#

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6
comment: Black is now weak on the dark squares.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4
comment: Now if 18... gxh5 then 19. Nh6# $1

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6
comment: The best defense but it is not good enough.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+
comment: Now White has a dark-squared bishop and Black doesn't. It will be difficult for Black to defend the dark squares.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6
comment: White now has an excellent position.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1
comment: White brings additional pieces into play before continuing the attack on the king. One threat is Bxg6 attacking the queen with the rook.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. Rfe1
comment: The threat is 23. Nf5 gxf5 24. Qg5+ Kh8 25. Bxf6+ winning the queen.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. Rfe1 Ne8 23. Nf5
comment: If Black plays 23... gxf5 then 24 Bxf5 (threatening Qxh7#) 24... f6 25 Bxe6 + Kh8 26 Bxc8 wins. If 23... exf5 then 24 Rxe7.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. Rfe1 Ne8 23. Nf5 Qc5 24. Re5
comment: White already has a plan to maneuver the rook to h8.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. Rfe1 Ne8 23. Nf5 Qc5 24. Re5 Bd5 25. Ne7+
comment: The begining of a mating combination.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. Rfe1 Ne8 23. Nf5 Qc5 24. Re5 Bd5 25. Ne7+ Qxe7 26. Qxh7+ Kxh7 27. Rh5+
comment: The pawn cannot capture the rook because the pawn is pinned by the bishop.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6 5. Ng3 e6 6. Nf3 c5 7. Bd3 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. a3 O-O 10. O-O b6 11. b4 Be7 12. Bb2 Qc7 13. b5 Na5 14. Ne5 Bb7 15. Ng4 Qd8 16. Ne3 Nd5 17. Qh5 g6 18. Ng4 Bf6 19. Nxf6+ Nxf6 20. Qh6 Rc8 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. Rfe1 Ne8 23. Nf5 Qc5 24. Re5 Bd5 25. Ne7+ Qxe7 26. Qxh7+ Kxh7 27. Rh5+ Kg8 28. Rh8#
comment: Black resigned three moves ago beacuse he saw this ending coming.
